Identification_Area.title: ESO NTT EMMI IMAGE DATA FROM SL9 IMPACTS WITH JUPITER V1.0

Modification_Detail.description: extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model

External_Reference.reference_text: Schulz, R., Th. Encrenaz, J.A. Stuewe, and G. Wiedemann. Near-IR emissions in the upper Jovian atmosphere after SL-9 impact: Indications of possible northern counterparts, Geophysical Research Letters, 22, 17, 2421-2424, 1995.

Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_name: ESO NTT EMMI IMAGE DATA FROM SL9 IMPACTS WITH JUPITER V1.0
Data_Set_PDS3.citation_text: Schulz, R., M. A'Hearn, Th. Encrenaz, J. Stuwe, and G. Wiedemann, ESO NTT EMMI IMAGE DATA FROM SL9 IMPACTS WITH JUPITER V1.0, ESO-C-EMMI-3-RDR-SL9-V1.0, NASA Planetary Data System, 1996.
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_terse_desc: ESO NTT EMMI Images of the P/Shoemaker-Levy 9 impact into Jupiter
Data_Set_PDS3.abstract_desc: ESO MultiMode Instrument has various spectroscopic options with large-field capabilities (up to 10 x 10 arcmin with a 2048**2 CCD).
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_desc:
Data Set Overview ================= ESO MultiMode Instrument has various spectroscopic options with large-field capabilities (up to 10 x 10 arcmin with a 2048**2 CCD).
The scheduling of the observing programmes at the NTT can be adapted to the sky conditions. When the image size is better than 0.7 arcsec, the telescope can be configured for observing with SUSI. In order to take full advantage of this unique capability, ESO has now introduced a special category of observing programmes which require exceptional seeing and are executed in a service mode by ESO staff when the sky conditions are favourable.
Processing ========== The EMMI data are calibrated broad-band (Johnson B,V,R,I) images of Shoemaker-Levy 9 taken about two weeks before the impact. They are calibrated for the construction of color-index maps, which means that -2.5*log (pixel value) yields 'magnitudes per square arc sec'. The PI for the program is Rita Schulz with Joachim A. Steuwe and Mike A'Hearn as collaborators.
EMMI Observation Log -------------------- FILE DATE-OBS TM-START EXPTIME AIRMASS OBJECT
int0026.fit '02/07/94' 03:01:01 1200 1.40752 'SL9 B 03x03' int0027.fit '02/07/94' 03:23:09 1200 1.53911 'SL9 B 03x03' int0052.fit '01/07/94' 03:57:22 900 1.76339 'SL9 V 03x03' int0053.fit '01/07/94' 04:19:03 900 2.01072 'SL9 R 03x03' int0054.fit '01/07/94' 04:40:52 900 2.36040 'SL9 I 03x03' int0092.fit '02/07/94' 03:48:18 900 1.71476 'SL9 R 17x01' int0093.fit '02/07/94' 04:06:53 900 1.90697 'SL9 I 17x02' int0094.fit '02/07/94' 04:28:38 900 2.21153 'SL9 I 17x02' int0095.fit '02/07/94' 04:50:19 900 2.65173 'SL9 R 17x02'
Data structure ============== SIMPLE = T / Standard FITS format BITPIX = 32 / No. of bits per pixel NAXIS = 2 / No. of axes in image NAXIS1 = 1124 / No. of pixels NAXIS2 = 1024 / No. of pixels EXTEND = T / FITS extension may be present BLOCKED = T / FITS file may be blocked
CRPIX1 = 1. / Reference pixel CRVAL1 = 1. / Coordinate at reference pixel CDELT1 = 0.37 / Coordinate increment per pixel CTYPE1 = 'ArcSec ' / Units of coordinate CRPIX2 = 1. / Reference pixel CRVAL2 = 1. / Coordinate at reference pixel CDELT2 = 0.37 / Coordinate increment per pixel CTYPE2 = 'ArcSec ' / Units of coordinate BUNIT = 'E-9rInt/SqArcSec' / Units of data values BSCALE = 1.51249546432E-08 / Scaling factor: r = f*i + z BZERO = 7.18707847595 / Zero offset: r = f*i + z DATAMAX = 39.6676712036 / Maximum data value DATAMIN = -25.2935142517 / Minimum data value
ORIGIN = 'ESO-MIDAS' / Written by MIDAS DATE = '12/07/95' / Date of writting: DD/MM/YY FILENAME= 'int0026.bdf' / Original file name MIDASFTP= 'IMAGE ' / MIDAS File Type
OBJECT = 'SL9 B 03x03' / MIDAS desc.: IDENT(1) RA = 212.19111 / MIDAS desc.: O_POS(1) DEC = -12.40573 / MIDAS desc.: O_POS(2) DATE-OBS= '02/07/94' / MIDAS desc.: O_TIME(1) MJD-OBS = 49535.12571 / MIDAS desc.: O_TIME(4) TM-START= 0. / MIDAS desc.: O_TIME(5) EXPTIME = 1. / MIDAS desc.: O_TIME(7) TELESCOP= 'ESONTTB ' / MIDAS desc.: TELESCOP(1) INSTRUME= 'EMMI ' / MIDAS desc.: INSTRUME(1) OBSERVER= 'SCHULZ ' / MIDAS desc.: OBSERVER(1) AIRMASS = 1.40752 / MIDAS desc.: O_AIRM(1) COMMENT / Time Reference System is used only for Sidereal time COMMENT / All other time info is got from instr. computer clock ESO-LOG 00:00:00> DATE = '1994-07-02' / Sat Jul 2, 1994 ESO-LOG 03:01:00>-START EXPO EMMI BLUE / Start exp. on CCD / EMMI BLUE ESO-LOG 03:01:01> EXPO EMMI BLUE NO = 10923 / Exp. num. on CCD / EMMI BLUE ESO-LOG 03:21:01>-STOP EXPO EMMI BLUE / Stop exp. on CCD / EMMI BLUE HISTORY COMPUTE/IMAG ffn0026.bdf = HISTORY (ntt0026.bdf-2.18000E+02)/nff0014.bdf/1.200 HISTORY 0E+03 COMPUTE/IMAG sub0026.bdf = ffn0026.bdf-midtemp HISTORY FILTER/MEDI sub0026.bdf fil0026.bdf 1,1,0.0 NR + NNE HISTORY FILTER/MEDI sub0026.bdf fil0026.bdf 1,1,0.0 HISTORY NR + NNE REBIN/ROTATE fil0026.bdf rot0026.b HISTORY f R2 + COMPUTE/IMAG cln0026.bdf HISTORY 1.0*rot0026.bdf proc/RelInt cln0 HISTORY 26.bdf int0026.bdf 8.48645E-01

Software ======== Standard IRAF reduction routines were used.
Media/Format ============ This dataset is 8 MM tape submission to PDS which was referenced in the Schulz et al. (1995) [SCHULZETAL1995] article.
